intro: Psoralea trianae, commonly known as the Trianza psoralea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod fruits. The plant typically grows in shrubland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea trianae is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
